111.content:
After waiting for a couple of minutes, you were the last in line to write your name. The man with the book looked at your small, lean countenance as you write the name "Alex Connell" on the sheet. The man picks up the guest book, looks at it, then looks at another sheet of paper. "Perfect," he says after a few seconds. Then he says to the entire group, "Follow me to the Great Room."

You weren't sure what the Great Room was, but if he knows it, you do also. On the way, you note the size of the mansion. The elegant, golden ceilings were held high above the red carpeted floor, with doors the size of houses with bronze numbers on them. Walls featured art of a man holding Pokemon, the same man, different Pokemon every painting.

After walking for about five minutes, without hearing a word from the mysterious man, you arrive in an enormous room large enough to hold six commercial airplanes, and among the most magnificent art and architecture in the world. Chandeliers covered the entire ceiling. The room was clashed with red, bronze, and gold.

At the far end of the room was another man, a Charizard, and a red bowl on a glass table. There was also what looked like from a distance to be a map of the entire mansion. Chairs were seated around the table, inviting the guests to come and attend some sort of orientation. The man near the bowl began to speak.

"Good afternoon. My name is Andrew Majors, who was recently elected to be Head of the Pokemon Manor Staff after Master Sterling passed away. Before he died, he asked to have one last wish granted. He wanted a group of young people, Trainers, Breeders, anyone interested in Pokemon, to come to the mansion, and to give one a taste of its glory.

"Now you have probably guessed, this event is his wish brought to life. We have invited 30 people of ages 11 to 17, who you sit among right now. You might have read in the letter that if you are worthy enough you will receive a prize fit for a king. We will not tell you the prize specifically at this time."

Murmurs burst through the crowd. What prize? How can we be worthy? And what the heck is this place anyway?

"We will first begin by randomly pairing you up with one of Master's Pokemon," Andrew continued. "There are 30 people here today, so you will be with a Pokemon of a group of 30 for your entire stay, like it or no. If we notice that Pokemon has a disliking towards you, you will be escorted out of the manor. So please, try to get along. Let's start in alphabetical order, so that means Katie Armstrong will go first. Drake, draw a Pokemon from the bowl."

"As you wish," the Charizard spoke as if he knew fluent English. 30 gasps came from the crowd. No Pokemon could speak a human language.

Drake, the Charizard, flapped his wings and a piece of paper flew out of the bowl. Andrew Majors caught it and read it. "'Venusaur'," he read. "Katie, you'll be paired up with Ivy in Room 15 during your stay. Please refer to the map for directions."

A small, 12 year old girl got up, dazed and confused. One would wonder if she was thinking if she could cope with such a monster or if it's a dream come true.

Two boys were then paired up with different Pokemon. Sammy Bacon was roomed with a Raichu named Watt. Peter Burbank got a Flareon named Torch.

"Next, Alex Connell. Drake?"

Drake flapped his wings again, and the paper of which Andrew Majors will read reveals which Pokemon?

(NOTE: If you are adding the Other chapter, try to make the choices powerful, but no legendaries. And they can't be the Pokemon already revealed.)
111.title: The Bowl of Fate

1111.content:
"'Gallade!'" Andrew read the paper. "You are a very lucky man, Alex. You'll be receiving one of Master's first and favorite Pokemon; Force the Gallade. He'll wait for you in Room 1. You should've saw the room on the walk over here."

Drake began to speak again. "I should warn you, he can have a nasty temper."

You were still scratching your head on how a Pokemon could speak English that fluently, but for now, you have to meet this Force that you have been assigned to. Speed-walking through the enormous corridors, you arrive at Room 1 near the entrance of the Manor, larger than life itself. The bronze doors were easily 30 feet tall, which made the knobs seem tiny.

You open a massive door to find the room completely dark. The door closed behind you. Nothing but pitch black everywhere. You take a step forward, hoping there's solid floor beneath it. Suddenly there was a flash of light, and the lights came on, revealing the room's glory. The same layout of the corridors were also presented here, only it was a bedroom covering half an acre of space. Besides the double-king size bed by the far end, it was completely empty. No Gallade inside.

Suddenly you felt a sharp pain on your cheek, blinding you temporarily. Then you found yourself pinned to the ground by a tall, unknown figure. Everything was blurry from the pain. The figure seemed to speak, "Who are you?"

You managed to grab the strength to say, "Alex Connell. Who are you and what do you want from me?"

"If you were there, and was chosen, you would know," the figure spake, as if it were a riddle.

"You're Force the Gallade. Now may I return to my senses?"

There was a slight pause, then the figure released you, and you began to restore your sight. Standing on your feet groggily, the figure spoke, "Please excuse me. I've been cranky and paranoid ever since Master passed away."

Your vision cleared, and you began to see a Gallade clearly. This Gallade was different, however. Most humans are slightly taller than a normal Gallade; this one was more than eight feet tall, and looked as fierce as ever. Maybe that's why Master Sterling loved him so much.

He gazed at your timid eyes, the bedhead, the pimpled face. Your gut, slimmer than the norm, along with your height. Your expression of fear mixed with depression. This he did for moments of silence. You decided to break it.

"So... how can all of the Pokemon here talk?"

He responded with a smirk, "How does a Gallade become eight feet tall?"

"Touche."

"Both are classified," he answers. You weren't seeing a good bond just yet, maybe it's too early, maybe you're not good enough for him.

The bronze doors opened again revealing the same man who led you to the Great Room. "It is now time for the opening banquet," he said.

11533222222211.content:
You were beaming with excitement as you looked down at the little blue plastic ticket. 120, it said in golden letters. You immediately rushed down the hall, following the other guests, searching for the room you’d been assigned. Finally, you were standing right in front of it. Room 120. You sigh, taking a deep breath to calm your nerves. Somehow, you knew that this was the first day of the rest of your life. With that thought, you reached forward and knocked on the door…

Only to realize it was already slightly ajar. You felt a little embarrassed when your gentle knock caused the door to just swing open. Still, you peeked curiously into the room. It looked sort of like a studio apartment, but without a bed, or a fridge, or any human amenities whatsoever, really. You only noticed a big Pokemon bed in the corner. “Hello?” You gently called, and heard rummaging from within as a pair of paws tapped softly along the floor. What came walking ‘round the corner had to be seen to be believed.

It seemed to be some kind of ninetales, but… blue? It was hard to even explain it. Rather than the straight fur you’d expect from a ninetales, her fur was incredibly curvy, and her paws, tails and ‘mane’ ended with snow white tips. She was obviously well groomed; her hair and tails almost seemed to defy the laws of physics, remaining perfectly in place as she walked over to you. You had read a lot about Pokemon, but you’ve never seen nor heard of anything like her. The biggest surprise, however, came the moment she opened her mouth. “Ah, well if it isn’t my humble guest! I’ll be honest, I was expecting… more.”

“You can talk?” You gasped. You had heard of talking Pokemon, but you weren’t sure if it was even possible. It was a shocking sight, to say the least. Something about hearing such a posh, aristocratic voice come from the mouth of a Pokemon was just… uncanny. It sort of freaked you out.

“Well, you haven’t done much research, have you?” The weird, blue ninetales said, rolling her eyes. “Of course I can talk. Every Pokemon in Sterling’s collection has received an extensive education.”

“W-what are you?” was your next question.

“What am I?” She smiled, placing a paw on her chest as she beamed with pride. “Why, I am simply the pinnacle of high class and beauty! The real question is, what is that?” She gestured distastefully to the jacket you were wearing.

“What?” You said, looking down, wondering if you heard her right. “This is a jacket.”

“It’s a disaster, is what it is. I've never laid eyes on something so gawdy. You shall take it off this instant,” she insists.

“... huh? You can’t tell me what to do,” you said, a little bit offended by the demand.

“Uh, actually, I can,” she replies. “Unless you want me to speak with the headmaster and have you escorted off the premises.”

Your heart sinks. If you’re kicked out of the manor, you’d never have a shot at Sterling’s fortune. “You can do that?”

She smirks. “Try me.”

You hesitate, before sighing. Best not to take any chances. “Ugh. Alright,” you comply, slipping your jacket off and tossing it aside. You gestured to your jeans and t-shirt. “Is this outfit fine at least, your majesty?” You ask sarcastically.

She places a paw on her chin as she stares at your outfit, as if pondering. “Hmm… well, it’s a start. But in my professional opinion, I’d say you’re due for a complete wardrobe change. Definitely a haircut, too,” she concluded, talking over her shoulder as she walked deeper into the room. “There will be time for that later, however! In the meantime, we shall go over your responsibilities.”

You follow her, checking out the apartment. “‘Responsibilities’?”

“Mhmm. Don’t worry, I’ve written up a schedule so you don’t forget,” she said, pulling a clipboard down from the nearest table. “Let’s see here. Ah. You will be up by at least 6 am to serve me breakfast and accompany me on a walk around the premises. From 7 till 8, you will wash and groom my fur and tails until I look properly presentable. After that…”

“Whoa, whoa, whoa!” You interrupted her, holding up your hands. You were fine with taking off your jacket, since she is your host and all, but these ‘responsibilities’ were far too much to expect from anybody, much less a guest! She was your host, not your master! “Sorry to burst your bubble, lady, but I’m not going to do any of that stuff!”

She looks a bit surprised by your outburst, before glaring. “You really don’t get it, do you?” She says, her voice a mixture of anger and amusement, though she tries to maintain a ladylike persona. “You are my guest, which means that if you don’t make me happy, I can have you kicked out. So if you want any chance of getting Sterling’s fortune, I suggest you do as I say.” She turns away, flicking her tails in your direction indignantly. “And no back-talk, you hear? A lady like myself doesn’t have time for your tomfoolery.”

With that, she stomps off, leaving you swelling with emotions. Apparently, your chances of your dreams coming true were all in the hands of a single, narcissistic, weird-looking ninetales. You weren’t sure whether to laugh or cry. All you knew for sure was that this was going to be a lot more difficult than you were expecting...

You spend some time getting your stuff unpacked while she busily grooms herself in preparation for dinnertime. Eventually, she turns to you, speaking up. “Ah! I just remembered that I forgot to introduce myself, what with all your annoying questions and all,” she said, and you roll your eyes. With all the grace and class she could muster, she bows humbly before you. “I am Madame Adelia, hailing from the exotic lands of Alola.” She maintains her pose, as if waiting for something. Eventually, she peeks an eye open. “And your name…?”

“Oh, uh, sup. I’m Vincent. I’m from, uh, Goldenrod city,” you stuttered, surprised, completely lacking any of her tact and grace.

She huffed as she stood up straight. “Ugh. You are truly hopeless,” she frowned. “This isn’t going to be nearly as fun as I was hoping.”

“We can agree on that, at least,” you sighed.

115332222222111.content:
The more time you spent with Adelia, the more you doubted whether or not Sterling had been a genius after all. If he was, why would he ever keep a Pokemon as insufferable as her? You’d only been around for a few minutes, and she was already bossing you around, making you do this or that while acting like she was so much better than you. She was obsessed with her appearance, too, always sitting in front of that mirror of hers, grooming her fur with almost obsessive dedication. By the time dinner rolled around, you’d only been hanging out with her for a couple hours, and already you were at your wit’s end. How could you stand three weeks of this?

Luckily, you didn’t have to bring Adelia along you with you to dinner today. For some reason, this feast was humans-only. As you shuffled into the dining room, you noticed all the other guests looked just as miserable and exhausted. The food looked delicious, at least, no doubt prepared by some of the top chefs in the region. As you sat there, licking your lips hungrily, you were interrupted by the man from before walking up onto the stage on the end of the room. “Ladies and gentlemen. Before you begin eating, I would like to go over the more pressing details of your stay here,” he says solemnly.

The room goes deathly silent as he clears his throat, preparing to make his announcements. “As you have probably noticed, Sterling has specifically assigned you Pokemon that are the direct opposite of you in terms of personality,” he explains, and the audience quietly gasps as they suddenly understand the situation. “If you are confident, you were given a host that is anxious and paranoid. If you are shy, your host is judgemental and narcissistic. If you avoid confrontation, your host is relentlessly aggressive, and so on.” He glances sternly up over his glasses. “Make no mistake; this is by design.”

“You see, Sterling convened with Mesprit itself in order to identify you all as candidates for his fortune. He knows your personalities in detail, and knows exactly what challenges will push you to your limits,” he said, gesturing to another portrait behind him — this one portraying mesprit. “As I’m sure you’ve already heard, there are two ways to be disqualified from ever obtaining Sterling’s fortune. The first is to leave the premises, under any circumstances. The second occurs if your host comes to me and requests you be removed from their room.”

There were a few worried murmurs around the table. “That may sound concerning, but know this; you are all on an even playing field. All of your hosts will be equally difficult for you to appease. Whether you make it through these three weeks depends on your ability to improvise and deal with the challenges that may be presented by your host,” he reassures you all. “If you truly have the gift, you will make it to the end of the competition. Mark my words.”

He glances down at the paper he was holding in his hands. “Now, onto the final bit of information. Every three days, you will faced with a challenge that will force you and your host to cooperate,” he explains. “You will not receive a reward for completing these challenges successfully. However, your host will. Thus, if you fail a challenge, your host will probably be very, very upset.” He looks up, glancing at every person at the table, one by one. “I would recommend you not fail any challenges.”

“Alright, that should be the end of it. Please, enjoy your meal.”

With that, he walked off stage, leaving the guests to silently start chowing down on your meals as you consider what he’s told you. You all had one thought on your mind — how were you possibly supposed to win this? You had no idea how to take care of Pokemon, especially one specifically chosen to be as difficult as possible. You shuddered as you realized you might not have the ‘gift’ at all. After all, only one person here could have the gift, and most of the guests looked a lot older and more experienced than you did. Were you hopelessly out of your league?

After dinner, you stumbled back to your room feeling drained and demoralized. Seeing Adelia’s smug face greeting you as you walked in certainly didn’t help. “Ah! There you are. I’ve been wondering what’s been taking you so long,” she smiled, sitting in front of that same mirror again. “Could you be a dear and help me with my nails? I have places to be, so hop to it, now!” You sigh as you sit down in front of her, grabbing the nail trimmers. Indeed, these three weeks were definitely going to be harder than you expected...

Day one at the ‘Pokemon Manor’ is not fun.

Adelia has you spending the day laboriously grooming her fur to the most meticulous detail, holding her things while you take a walk around the grounds, and other completely unnecessary tasks. To be honest, part of you thinks she’s just toying with you; seeing how far she can push you before you give up. Well, if this is just the beginning, you shudder to imagine what she’ll have you do as the month drags on. Eventually, you return to her room, your scheduled list of chores for the day finally completed. Exhausted, you collapse on the couch, hoping she’d leave you alone now...

Of course, you have no such luck. “Let it be known that, even to such a pathetic guest, I am nothing if not a gracious host,” she says, and you groan at the sound of her voice. You just want to get some rest! “You, my friend, are going to get a complete makeover. I shall spare no expense!”

“Hurray,” you mumble sarcastically, rolling your eyes.

She sizes you up, rubbing her chin with a paw as if contemplating. “Hmm… for today, let’s start with getting rid of that atrocious bowl cut of your’s,” she decides.

“Is this really necessary?” You glare, begrudgingly sitting up.

“Absolutely!” She insists. “I shall not be seen with a guest so… homely. It would leave people with a terrible impression of me!”

“I highly doubt anybody cares…” You say, hoping she would take the hint and just buzz off.

“Oh, complain, complain, complain. I’ll be funding this makeover out of my own pocket, you know,” she says, growing impatient with you. “I know a smeargle who’s an incredible hair stylist. Just go to the lobby and ask for Jonah. Have him give you something nice. Tell him it’s on me.” You stand up, a little dazed, trying to process her instructions. “Make it snappy, now.”

“Um… okay,” you react, trying to memorize what she had just said. You wonder lackadaisically out into the lobby, dedicated to putting as little effort into this task as you possibly can. Sure enough, the man from before was at the desk, apparently in the process of wrapping things up. “Is there a, uh, Jonah around here?” He gives you an indiscernible look, before seemingly buzzing someone on his laptop. A few moments later, a smeargle suddenly pops out from a nearby hallway! “Whoa!”

“Well, don’t you look like a bright young lad?” He talks quickly, grabbing you by the hand and leading you down the hall. “You must be bright — you’ve chosen the greatest stylist in the region! Right this way, sir.” He gestures you into his room.

“... alright,” you responded, a bit taken aback. Were all the Pokemon around here complete narcissists?

You stepped into the smeargle’s room, only to find the living area has been repurposed into a surprisingly fancy barber shop. There was a big, leather chair and everything. “Now, I must admit, being the resident couffier of the Pokemon manor, I mostly have experience dealing with, well, fur,” he smiles, gesturing to the chair, “but I’m more than confident I can tame that ‘do of yours.”

“Uh, thanks,” you say as you take a seat.

“You know, there’s been humans roaming around the manor all day, with their hair mangy and unkempt, just begging for my skill and finesse… but you’re the first to come to me!” He says as he wraps a cape around your body. “May I ask how you heard of me?”

“Adelia sent me,” you reply.

“Ah, Adelia! My favorite customer, she is. She’s the only ‘mon around here who can truly appreciate my craft,” he smiles at the mention of her name. “I assume you’re her guest?”

“Yup,” you sigh, not feeling nearly as enthusiastic as he seems to be. “She wants to give me a ‘makeover’. Said she was paying for it.”

“Yes. I was considering hosting a guest myself, you know, but I’m simply too busy. My career requires hard work and dedication, after all,” he says, getting his tools prepared. “So, tell me; did you have anything in mind?” You consider the question. You don’t actually know what kind of haircut Adelia wanted you to get; she just said to get ‘something nice’. You assume that means you can ask for whatever you want. Unfortunately, you don’t know the first thing about hair.

"...and an eighty percent chance of rain, so take an umbrella with you outdoors!"
"Later tonight: a robbery report at the Central Plaza Mall. Thank you, everyone, and tune in next time!"

The television screen faded to a blank screen and resumed regular programming, with advertisements brought up first. The anchorman sitting in front of the television turned off the screen, groaning to himself saying "Aw, stupid ads... Oh well, I did a great job at the weather report anyway! Heheh..." Another young man walked into the room to greet his friend as the two of them fist bumped, with a red letter in his left hand. "Hey, just came back from work and found this letter in the mail." Mr. anchorman stood up with excitement twinkling in his eyes, saying "Ooh, it's red!" "And you know what that means, right Travis?" Travis jumped into the air and suddenly looked like his friend, but younger in age and in more ideal clothing. "It means it's uncommon mail, Rod!" Rod smiled and showed Travis the mail, already opened and exquisitely red accompanied with gold shining font. "Wow! Why are you always the lucky one? I mean, going to a mansion? That's huge!" However, instead of replying with a usual "I know, right," Rod handed Travis the letter, it's weight surprisingly greater than that of regular postage. "Uh, Rod... You are gonna go there, right?"

Rod shook his head and sat down on the couch, sighing and crossing his arms. "Well, it's just that... there's this thing I call a job, y'know, and... business over interest, I suppose. Oh, and I haven't been around long enough to get vacation time, either." Travis shined purple again, and this time he reverted to his original form, a Zoroark. "Come on, man. You can't just let this slide..." Rod looked up at Travis and smiled again, giving him a thumbs up. "Don't worry, dude. You can go there and tell me all about it when you come back." Travis stepped backwards, exclaiming "This seems a bit more fitting for an actual human! Come on!" "Don't worry, Travis. Besides, how long have we known each other? How long have you been living like a human yourself?" Actually, the two of them have been more like brothers if anyone looked at their childhood. Travis was only a newly hatched Zorua when Rod's mom picked him up from an adoption building when he was only two years old, and ever since then they have had the luxury of living under the same roof. Rod even taught Travis what he learned at school, giving him past spirals and notes from his classes and helping each other out with problems. Now, the two of them live in an apartment.

"Yeah, I know... You sure you wanna give me the honors?"
"I'm positive!"
"Okay... I'll pack up what I need!"
"I doubt you'll need much, but if you insist..."
"Come on, if I go there with nothing, won't that look strange?"
"Yeah, you're right. Oh, what did the weatherman say today?"
"It'll most likely rain."
"Okay."
15.title: Human...?

"Stupid weatherman and his 'eighty percent chance of rain' crap. It's pouring like there's no tomorrow!" Travis stood outside in front of the apartment complex in his usual younger Rod appearance, with only an umbrella and a light jacket to protect himself from the weather. His suitcase was wrapped up in towels next to him, now rendered as a sopping wet mass of, well, towels. "Finally, there's my ride!" A taxi drove by, then kept going it's way down the street. "... Darn..." Looked like it was the wrong ride for Travis, which meant more waiting in the rain. A crackle of thunder could be heard in the distance; a red bus looked as if it would keep going, but stopped in front of Travis. Finally. A man stepped out from the back seat, dressed in a suit and occupied with a large umbrella. "Ah, you must be one of the participants. May I see the letter?" Pulling it from your pocket to reveal a drenched red letter, you could only chuckle on the matter and tell the man "Here it is, more or less." Inspecting it quickly, the man set the suitcase inside the bus and signaled Travis to hop in, saying "Come now, Rod (heheh). This weather is begging to get worse." "Gladly!" Once inside, Travis couldn't help but notice the fancy decor and tinted windows.

Other people were there, too, minding each other's business and doing whatever they felt would pass the time. A kid in the back waved at Travis and signaled him over to sit with him. Now, he may have been like a human for the past twenty years, but nevertheless he was still wary of others. Just do it. I mean, he's just a kid! Travis sat next to the peppy little boy, who had eyes as big as the moon right now. "Oh, hello! I'm really excited about this mansion! You looked more normal than anyone else, so I thought you would be a good seating buddy!" Analyzing the kid, he seemed to be quite the trainer with all of his gear, yet no Pokemon around his waist. "You, uh, seem to be quite the trainer there." Travis could've sworn his eyes grew even bigger at the mere mention of Pokemon, to which the kid happily remarked "Thanks! I couldn't bring my Pokemon with me because my mom wouldn't let me, but they are sooo strong! Look at how many badges I have!" He held up his little messenger bag to show the five badges pinned on the front, proudly displayed with his name 'Tommy' next to it.

"Wow, that's pretty impressive." Travis attempted to comment on the colorful badges, finding no real interest in them.
"Thanks again! Oh man, when we get there, I'm gonna see sooo many Pokemon, and I would be like 'Oh, boy!' when I walk inside!"
"Mm-hmm."
"Oh, my Herracross rocked at my last battle! He was all like 'Shoom! Wa-bam! Pow!' with his strength!" The kid was like an endless bag of wind, geez.

"Is that so?"

1513.content:
Travis kept his comment to himself though, seeing a few people looking at Tommy and himself in a manner that says "Shut up, y'all!" Several hours go by, and Tommy started nudging Travis to wake up, saying "Hey! Hey! Hey! We're here! Finally!" Travis yawned and stretched his arms, taking notice of the fact that it wasn't raining anymore and of Tommy's bouncing up and down in our seat. "Come on, chill. I'm afraid you may explode all over me in anticipation." Tommy made a face at him and exclaimed "Yeah, I don't wanna give all of my excitement to you!" Who does he take after? A Smugleaf? The kid's smug look now burned into Travis' memory; maybe Travis should disguise himself as Tommy later and give him a little visit? Hehehe, that'll be too funny! Travis felt the bus come to a complete stop, hearing the man in the suit say to everyone "Please get your coats and bags and step off the bus." Conveniently, Travis could freely take off the layers of still soggy towels to reveal a perfectly dry suitcase, and Tommy couldn't help but say as he was climbing over him "Wow! You could look like a business man with that!" "Very funny." Stepping off the bus and onto the Mansion property, seeing the structure beyond a large gate was really breathtaking! "Holy cats, that's big..."

"Tell me about it..." A lady looking to be around her late twenties stood next to Travis, having her hands on her hips and dark eyeliner carefully edged around her eyes. She was most definitely not attractive to you, but if someone were to gawk at her, they would most likely say "She's so beautiful... and rich..." Her outfit screamed out the 'rich' factor. "Well, time to get going..." Her voice was very smooth and calm, but that had no interest to one such as Travis. Maybe a non-romantic comment towards her wouldn't hurt, but loving her would just be weird... Especially for him. Travis eyed the mansion, but couldn't help but see her blow a kiss towards him. "The name's Rose, by the way..." I didn't even ask for her name! Now to proceed through the large gates and into the mansion...

"Greetings guests, and welcome to the Pokemon Manor!" Travis looked at a tall man in another black suit, looking as crisp as crisp could get. He patted a book on a small table in front of him and continued, "If I may please ask that everyone would sign their name into our guest book." A line was formed, and the signing procedure was as good as done. While Travis signed an impeccable copy of Rod's signature, he could feel little eyes piercing right through him, to which Travis assumed to be Tommy. "Oh, your name is Rod! Hi Rod!" "Hello, Tommy." Everyone waited for the man to collect his guest book; Travis heard an anxious pitter-patter sound behind him, noticing Tommy jumping up and down as his curious eyes probed the interior. "If I could have everyone's attention, please!" Everyone turned to face him, and Travis couldn't help but feel like a stranger among the crowd of humans. "My name is Andrew Majors, head-of-staff of this manor, and let me be the first to say thank you for your participation. I know that you all are wondering what it is that you have agreed to and you will find out at dinner tonight. But before that, we should show all of you where you each will be sleeping at. Now I have gathered," he paused for a bit as he pulled out several envelopes from underneath the table, continuing "these envelopes contain a card with a color and a number. The cards will tell you what room you will be staying in and some scarce information about your host.”

The man handed Travis and everyone else an envelope, to which you said a casual "Thank you" to the man. This card is...

At that moment, Andrew departed up a flight of stairs and went through a door, out of sight. He... seems alright. For a guy in a suit, anyway. One of the servants approached Travis and politely asked for the card. "Ah, I see. Stay close, now, as I direct you to---" "Yay! Guess what, Rod!? My room number is 123! We're reeealy close by!" Tommy held his card up proudly, doing a dance that may either mean he's excited or has to use the bathroom. "Okay that's, uh, great." Travis had nothing else better to do anyway, so why not give Rod a call? Opening his suitcase, Travis pulled out a phone that Rod used to use until he had purchased a newer one. If smart phones were really smart, wouldn't they just upgrade themselves the way a Porygon would? Technology is just so confusing nowadays; Travis opened the contacts menu and went down through the alphabet until he found Rod's name. With the touch of a screen, the phone instantly dialed Rod's number and waited for him to pick up. A few rings later, Rod answered:

"(Hello there, Travis the Zoroark.)"

Assuming that was his side of the room, Travis tossed his suitcase on top of the bed and laid out all of his items. Into the nearby drawer they went, and organization had assumed control over his side of the room. While Travis was adjusting the clock, the a/c kicked in. I guess they finally fixed it. Awful lot faster than what the servant thought. Everything was set up, and now all Travis needed to do was to meet his host and attend dinner.

Have you heard about us having the knowledge of the human tongue?" Travis felt the temperature continue to drop, but he didn't mind since he can adjust to weather conditions a bit. "I can't recall if I have. I have communicated with a Porygon a whole lot lately, but it only speaks what it downloads. I guess I have gotten used to it." 151322121.title: Dinner's Served

1513221211.content:
The fire-type Pokemon took a seat at the head of the table. Travis whispered over to Yuki. "Drake's the Charizard over there?" She answered back in a hushed voice. "Yes, but I think Andrew's introducing him." Travis nodded, and directed his attention over to the orange lizard. Andrew then continued to announce his important message. "May I introduce to everyone Master Matthew's first Pokemon, Drake." He then pulled out a chair for Drake politely; Drake thanked him kindly, then looked at all of the guests with piercing eyes. "Greetings guests." His voice was nice and loud, fitting for such a Charizard with visible scars. The several scars on his face and body were most likely from past trainer battles. “It is a privilege to finally meet all of you. As you know Matthew Sterling, the owner of this Manor, has recently passed.” Everyone fell silent in respect for his recently deceased owner and friend. “Before his death he asked me one favor, and that was to find someone who could take care of all his Pokemon. That someone is one of you.” Everyone remained silent as the thought of owning the entire estate dawned on everyone. Wow, an entire estate... I wonder how difficult that would be, not to mention stressful? Drake lifted a sheet of paper, bringing it up to his face.

“Now I’m going the read the Rules that was disclosed in the Masters will. In the event of my death I wish for you to invite 30 random individuals to stay at the Manor. Each guest is to be paired with a Pokemon host. The guest is to stay with his or her host Pokemon and must participate with the Pokemon when asked no matter what the request my be. If the Pokemon is ever displeased with it’s guest or a guest breaks a rule of the house the guest will be disqualified and will leave the manor immediately. A guest may leave by request if he or she wishes to. Who whoever is remaining at the end shall inherit all of my estate.” Drake then proceeded to let everyone eat upon announcement. "Hey, Yuki?" She turned towards Travis and asked "What is it?" Travis spun his fork around while explaining: "If multiple guests win, does that mean multiple people are allowed to own this place?" She nodded. "I guess you could be right, as long as everyone gets along. Why do you want to know?" Travis shrugged. "Well, it would be better to have more people to share the place with, like of how my brother and I share the same apartment."

They all continued talking about the topic in question until dinner was over...

info.brief_description: You get a strange invitation to stay at a mansion. What mysteries will await you there?
info.description:
Prologue

One day You receive a strange letter. The letter had no send or return address the only thing written on it was the name “Matthew Sterling”. You remember hearing the name before, He was a very rich man who collected Pokemon for a living. It was said that he collected every Pokemon in every color, type, and gender you could imagine. You open the letter and read the message inside.

“Dear (Your Name)

I’m sad to announce that our master, Matthew Sterling has recently past away. As disclosed in his will he wishes to find someone to look after his vast collection. So I wish to say congratulations that you have been selected to participate in this once in a life time opportunity. You and 29 other individuals have been selected to stay 3 weeks at Mr. Matthew’s home “The Pokemon Manor”. If you are deemed worthy to shale receive a prize fit for a king. A Bus will pick you up in front of your house at 10:30 sharp. You will receive more information once you arrive.

From: Andrew Majors
Head of Manor Staff.”

The invitation seemed a bit strange to you but there was no way that you where going to turn it down.


You can either take the role as a Human guest at the Manor or one of the Pokemon that lives at the Manor.
Feel free to take the story in any direction you like as long as I doesn’t break any rules.

Notes

Basically this is how the challenge works. Each guest will be roomed with a Pokemon in the Manor. The guest will stay with that Pokemon and interact with it 24/7. If at any time a Pokemon dislikes the guest He or she will be disqualified and must leave the Manor. The guest my also leave by choose if he or she wishes to. There are also times the guest must participate in a special challenge where it changes how the guest and the Pokemon must interact.

The Pokemon can talk in this story they can do just about anything. Also the Pokemon can either be Kind and Nice to the guests or be Mean and Devious it’s up to you. Also the people can’t die in this story. No anthro Pokemon please.


Rules
Things I will allow:
Size Change.
Transformation.
Soft Vore.
Mild Language.

Things I won’t allow:
Sexual content.
Gore.
Scat.
Obsessive cursing.
